clinic in Belfast and your baby 
will	be	offered	a	course	of	
immunisations starting at 
birth to help prevent them 
becoming infected and reduce 
the chance of them developing 
long term liver disease.
HIV screening
HIV is a virus that attacks the 
immune system and can pass 
to the baby during pregnancy, 
at delivery, or after birth by 
breastfeeding. (page 49). If 
your screening tests is positive 
for HIV you will be referred tov 
genito-urinary medicine (GUM)
